SafetyInspectionBy: NC Department of Labor - Boiler Safety Bureau

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Urethane and Other Foam Product (except Polystyrene) Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at your facility:  This facility complies with the National Fire Protection Association's Liquefied Petroleum Gas Code (NFPA-58).  It is CPI Packaging Inc.'s (CPI's) policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an emergency were to occur, CPI's policy is to notify the City of Lincolnton Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.

A description of your facility and the regulated substances handled:  This facility manufactures polyethylene foam.  A 69.20 mole percent isobutane and 30.80 mole percent propane mixture is used in polyethylene foam manufacturing.  The regulated process consists of one isobutane / propane 7,933-gallon storage tank and the associated polyethylene foam manufacturing equipment.

The worst-case and alternative release scenarios:  CPI's worst-case scenario is failure of the 7,933-gallon storage tank when filled to the greatest amount allowed (85%), resulting in a vapor cloud explosion. The resulting distance to the endpoint extends offsite, and public receptors are within the distance to the endpoint. CPI's alternative release scenario is a break in a 2-inch diameter pipe handling the gas phase, leading to a 60-minute release and explosion. The resulting distance to the endpoint extends offsite, and public receptors are within the distance to the endpoint.  No administrative controls and mitigation measures where used to limit the impacts of the reported scenarios.

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:  This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration's Process Safety Management standard, and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. The isobutane / propane system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA-58 and state law. 

Five-year accident history:   CPI has never had

an accident involving isobutane / propane that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or shelterings in place. 

The emergency response program:   In the event of an emergency involving the isobutane / propane system, it is CPI's policy to notify the City of Lincolnton Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency. We have coordinated our response plans with the fire department and members of the fire department have inspected the facility. 

Planned changes to improve safety:   None.
